section: IV - Think tanks, research and academic institutions
membership:
Elettra - Sincrotrone Trieste S.C.p.A. is part of the primary network for science and technology of the Central European Initiative (CEI), it has established long-term relations with the International Center for Theoretical Physics (ICTP) of UNESCO and the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA). 
Elettra - Sincrotrone Trieste S.C.p.A.  is also funding member of the FELs of Europe collaboration, derived from the ESFRI EuroFEL project (www.fels-of-europe.eu) and actively participates in the LEAPS (League of European Accelerators for Photon Science) Roadmapping excercise, preparing the ground for integrating plans after 2020.
relevant_communication:
The most notable achievements in 2017 has been the directly attendance in numerous large-scale International Projects such as:  
• CERIC-ERIC, a distributed research infrastructure, upon the definition by the European Strategy Forum for Research Infrastructures (ESFRI), set up in the legal form of an ERIC (European Research Infrastructure Consortium, Council Regulation n.723/2009). 
• Euro-BioImaging, a large‐scale pan‐European research infrastructure project on the European Strategy Forum on Research Infrastructures (ESFRI) Roadmap. It will provide open user access to a complete range of state-of-the-art imaging technologies in biological, molecular and medical imaging for life scientists in Europe and beyond. 
• The Extreme Light Infrastructure (ELI), a laser facility that aims to host the most intense lasers world-wide and develop new interdisciplinary research opportunities with light from these lasers. It will be based on three sites, hosted by the Czech Republic, Hungary and Romania. 
• European Spallation Source (ESS), a multi-disciplinary research centre based on the world’s most powerful neutron source. It will enable new opportunities for researchers in the fields of life sciences, energy, environmental technology, cultural heritage and fundamental physics. 
• EuroFEL groups all European free electron lasers as a follow-up of the ESFRI project (listed in the Landscape analysis of the 2016 ESFRI Roadmap) fostering technolgoical developments, networking and integration.  
• Nanoscience Foundries and Fine Analysis (NFFA), is a project integrating in a multisite combination advanced infrastructures specialized on growth, lithography, characterization, theory, simulation and fine-analysis of nanomaterials with Synchrotron, FEL and Neutron radiation sources.  
 
In addition, Elettra - Sincrotrone Trieste S.C.p.A.  is taking part in the following Horizon 2020 projects: 
• BrightnESS, strenghtnening the scientific case and user community of the European Spallation Source ESFRI project, now in its construction phase; 
• EUCALL, grouping optical lasers, IR FELs and X-Rays FELs into an integrated network; 
• LASERLAB-EUROPE, the Integrating Activites of European laser facilities, now including also ELI and European XFEL; 
• OPEN SESAME, with the aim to train the scientists, technicians and future users of the SESAME synchrotron in Jordan. 
• CALIPSOplus, the integrating activity grouping all European synchrotrons and free electron lasers into a multidisciplinary integrated network of excellence. 
• CompactLight (XLS), a project where Elettra – Sincrorone Trieste S.C.p.A. is the coordinator that, under a 3M€ Horizon 2020 grant, involving 24 academic and industrial partners from Europe, China and Australia. CompactLight (XLS) will provide the design of an innovative hard X-ray FEL facility, based on the X-band (12 GHz) technology. The project, in the Grant Preparation phase during 2017, has started in January 2018.
